Metadata.Title: Test Data Is Removed Before the Production System Becomes Active
Metadata.DirectLink: Test Data Is Removed Before the Production System Becomes Active
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 6.3.5
  • PCI DSS Requirement 6.3.6

What to Check For

Check that test data is removed. Verify that test accounts are removed. Ensure that test passwords are changed.

Why

Test data and accounts may cause undesirable results in an application when it is deployed, such as making available privileged accounts with easy-to-guess passwords.

How to Check

Review the documentation of the development process and interview the staff to make sure that the test data and accounts are removed before the applications are deployed.

How to Fix

Add a description of the process to remove all test data and accounts from applications before they are deployed to the documentation of the software development cycle. Instruct the development personnel to remove all custom and test data and accounts from applications before they enter the production environment.
